body.raw:
Huan Zhang is a Software Engineer (Senior Consultant) at Capgemini, Singapore, supporting CrÃ©dit Agricole CIB's Data Regulatory Reporting team. At CACIB, he designed and developed data ingestion probes to capture upstream trade records in accordance with regulatory specifications, publishing real-time messages to downstream Kafka topics for post-trade reporting. He supports the data quality platform and applies various regulatory frameworks including MAS, HKTR, JSFTR, CFTC, MiFID and other compliance standards to ensure accurate regulatory submissions. He specializes in high-performance distributed systems, advanced search architectures and cloud infrastructure optimization. Previously at Works Applications, he significantly improved Elasticsearch and DynamoDB solutions, driving substantial performance and efficiency gains.

Huan holds a Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence from Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST). In his free time, he enjoys exploring innovative software architectures and cloud technologies.

body.raw:
At birth, Ged was given the child-name Duny by his mother. He was born on the island of Gont, as a son of a bronzesmith. His mother died before he reached the age of one. As a small boy, Ged had overheard the village witch, his maternal aunt, using various words of power to call goats. Ged later used the words without an understanding of their meanings, to surprising effect.

The witch knew that using words of power effectively without understanding them required innate power, so she endeavored to teach him what little she knew. After learning more from her, he was able to call animals to him. Particularly, he was seen in the company of wild sparrowhawks so often that his "use name" became Sparrowhawk.
